JUDGES: Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr A. GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were initiated in respect of the applicant , who was suspected of fraud .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was taken into custody . He was released on DATE . An obligation not to leave his place of residence was imposed on him .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE the applicant ’s property , including his share in a house and his bank accounts , was attached . CARDINAL of the bank accounts was released on DATE ; the house was attached until DATE . The remaining bank accounts were released by a judgment of ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was committed for trial before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant of fraud .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was acquitted by ORG . It was noted in the judgment that the applicant had no right to compensation under LAW ( Riigi poolt isikule alusetult vabaduse võtmisega tekitatud kahju hüvitamise seadus ) for the period of detention from DATE to CARDINAL DATE , since his detention had been ordered because he had evaded the criminal proceedings ; in such a case the law did not provide for compensation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declined to accept an appeal lodged by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim for compensation for the pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage he had allegedly sustained as a result of the criminal proceedings . ORG was of the opinion that the length of the proceedings before the courts DATE and DATE had not been excessive , and that DATE of that period were attributable to the applicant .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the Police and ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) rejected a claim by the applicant for compensation . In respect of the deprivation of liberty it was noted that the applicant had not appealed against ORG judgment whereby it had been determined that he was not entitled to compensation . With regard to the criminal proceedings , it was found that the case had been complicated and that no unlawful measures had been taken in respect of the applicant . ORG considered that no non - pecuniary or pecuniary damage had been proved that would justify an award of compensation . The applicant was informed in the ORG ’s refusal that a complaint against its decision could be lodged with ORG within DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to pay the applicant compensation for the pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage he claimed in respect of the criminal proceedings against him . ORG considered that the restrictions imposed on the applicant during the criminal proceedings ( attachment of his property , obligation not to leave his place of residence ) had been lawful and not exceptionally harsh .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant lodged with ORG a claim for compensation for pecuniary damage caused by the criminal proceedings . The case ( no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) was transferred to ORG , which had jurisdiction over the matter . By amendments he had made to his claim on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE , the applicant had also claimed compensation for the non - pecuniary damage allegedly caused by the excessive length of the criminal proceedings and the obligation not to leave his place of residence . In the course of the proceedings before ORG the applicant also referred to his application pending before ORG ( that is , the present case ) and mentioned the sum proposed to him by the ORG under the friendly - settlement procedure .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s claim in part . It awarded him MONEY ( ORG ) as compensation for the non - pecuniary damage caused by the excessive length of the criminal proceedings and the obligation not to leave his place of residence . In determining the sum of the award , the court also made reference to the sum proposed to the applicant in the friendly - settlement procedure . The compensation claim for pecuniary damage was dismissed .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE in the case of PERSON ( no . DATE ) ORG declared LAW ( ORG seadus ) unconstitutional in so far as it did not provide for compensation for non - pecuniary damage caused by excessive length of a preliminary investigation in criminal proceedings , and awarded the complainant a sum of money . It further considered that the enactment of a special regulation for compensation for damage arising from criminal proceedings was required ( for a more complete summary of the judgment , see GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
